intro: Chaenostoma pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered chaenostoma, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of violet or purple. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it a distinctive member of the viola family, though it is less commonly cultivated than other members.
